availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Perry Bishop (Clay County, KY, farmer and soldier, 14th KY cav, USA)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Vica Bishop. Father of Eliza A. Bishop, Archibald Bishop, Sarah J. Bishop, and Willliam Bishop. Resident of Clay County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Clay County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from February 13, 1863 to March 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 130B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 100.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Precinct 3, p. 193B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0128.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #1154.619, Certificate #892628.
Find A Grave, "Perry Bishop (c1836-c1920)," Memorial #21739373, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21739373 (accessed July 6, 2020).
